messages: 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:39): "prototyping ARIA validation in RELAX NG". ah. good, hsivonen . at the rate I'm going, it's a good thing you're going to get http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/actions/11 done before I do
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:39): " Apple video workshop position paper" ... reminds me of http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/actions/31 ...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:40): he's not going, but someone else from Apple will, iirc
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:43): the question is whether the apple paper subsumes what Singer wrote (perhaps by citing it...)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:43): http://www.w3.org/2007/08/video/papers.html Standardized multimedia elements in HTML5, Kevin Calhoun, Eric Carlson, Adele Peterson, Antti Koivisto  (Apple).
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:44): I don't see anything about codecs in there
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:45): "This paper does not discuss the nature of the audio/video coding or its container format.

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:45): We agree that standardizing some format(s) is desirable for interoperability. However, the problems and issues raised by that question are not the subject of this paper, but are being handled, we believe, by the W3C staff."
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:47): er... MikeSmith where did ACTION-39 come from? when did I accept that? grumble... tracker's audit trails still need work
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (19:49): I think I put it on you, Dan.  :)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:49): you can't assign actions to people who aren't there.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:50): i.e. an action is a record that somebody _agreed_ to do something.
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (19:50): the issue changelog says who did what
eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee (19:50): another failing of tracker.  :)
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (19:50): but the action one doesn't
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:51): re-assigns it to ChrisW until it's more clear what's going on
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:52): is it a dup of ACTION-31?
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (19:52): I can email Systems and ask them if that feature is on their radar.
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (19:52): (i've done that before and Dom got back to me very quickly...)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:52): yes, Dom rocks
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:53): finally found Singer's msg... http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2007Nov/0153.html
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:55): updates ACTION-31... wonders about due date... which reminds me...
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:55): when is our next telcon?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:56): eb8a98129bf103327310edbb5652fcee, I don't see any specifics about next meeting in http://www.w3.org/2007/12/07-html-wg-minutes.html

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:57): 13 Dec I'll be at the video workshop... 1pm Boston is 9am SJC. If it were 7:30 or something, I could maybe chair from a hotel, but I don't think I should duck out of the workshop
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:57): does anybody have any agenda requests that shouldn't wait for a week? Can I cancel the 13 Dec meeting?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:58): wfm
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (19:58): can't attend anyway

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (19:59): changes topic to 'next HTML WG meeting (1p Boston time Thu, 13 Dec) at risk; any critical agenda? http://www.w3.org/html/wg/tracker/agenda (logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ ) '
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:00): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, pls update due date of ACTION-34; when do you estimate the WG should talk about it next?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:00): wonders if anyone besides the TAG is potentially confused by using "resources" instead of "representations of resources"
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:00): doesn't see GR around re ACTION-24
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:01): where, e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:01): is personally confused by the latter
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:01): that was a review comment of one of the TAG members on access-control
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:02): doesn't feel strongly about it just now
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:02): isn't even swapped in on that
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:04): asks my.t-mobile.com for this week's calendar; response is rediculously slow
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:04): "The connection to the server was reset while the page was loading."
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (20:05): is tempted to hack on http://homer.w3.org/~connolly/projects/palmagent/ to the point where my.t-mobile.com is out of the loop
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (20:25): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef, ok. It'll probably be a couple of weeks at least
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:35): so was end of next week the agreed upon deadline?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:37): it is
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:49): hi
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (20:51): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: sorry for misattributing a quote to you on that ALA article. :( that wasn't my intention at all.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (20:51): 78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9: no prob, I think my correction was sufficient
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (20:51): I've been in Seattle for a bit apartment hunting, so I haven't been around to properly send my regrets on that.
